LABORATORY.Definition: a room or building with scientific equipment for doing scientific tests or for teaching science, or a place where chemicals or medicines are produced

UNORTHODOX.Definition: different from what is usual or expected in behaviour, ideas, methods, etc.

WORKSHOP.Definition: a room or building where things are made or repaired using machines and/or tools

EUREKA.Definition: used to show that you have been successful in something you were trying to do

DISTILLING.Definition: to make a liquid stronger or purer by heating it until it changes to a gas and then cooling it so that it changes back into a liquid

DAWN.Definition: the period in the day when light from the sun begins to appear in the sky, the start of

CONCENTRATED.Definition: using a lot of effort to succeed at one particular thing

STUMBLED ACROSS.Definition: to discover or find something or someone by chance

RADAR.Definition: a system that uses radio waves to find the position of objects that cannot be seen

MELTED.Definition: having turned soft or into a liquid

PATENT.Definition: the official legal right to make or sell an invention for a particular number of years

MIRACLE.Definition: an unusual and mysterious event that is thought to have been caused by a god because it does not follow the usual laws of nature

ABANDONED.Definition: left in a particular place or condition, usually forever

PILOT.Definition: to test a new product before it is sold

SIDE-EFFECT.Definition: an unpleasant effect of a drug that happens in addition to the main effect

RELUCTANT.Definition: not willing to do something and therefore slow to do it

TIGHTEN.Definition: to become tighter or to make something become tighter, firmer, or less easy to move

LACES.Definition: a string that you use to fasten openings, especially in shoes, by putting it through two lines of small holes and tying the ends together

FLUFFY.Definition: soft and like wool or fur

HOOKS.Definition: a curved device used for catching or holding things, especially one attached to a surface for hanging things on

FUR.Definition: the thick hair that covers the bodies of some animals, or the hair-covered skin(s) of animals, removed from their bodies

SYNTHETIC.Definition: Synthetic products are made from artificial substances, often copying a natural product

ASTRONAUTS.Definition: people who have been trained for travelling in space

BARE.Definition: without any clothes or not covered by anything

AWKWARD.Definition: difficult to use, do, or deal with, embarrassing

HOLLOW.Definition: having a hole or empty space inside

SCRATCHED.Definition: to cut or damage a surface or your skin slightly with or on something sharp or rough

DEVICE.Definition: an object or machine that has been invented for a particular purpose

UNCONVENTIONAL.Definition: different from what is usual or from the way most people do things
